titles.title: All that we were—our sin, our guilt

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8 v9

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}All that we were—our sin, our guilt, Our death—was all our own: All that we are we owe to Thee, Thou God of grace alone.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}All that we are, as saints on earth, All that we hope to be, When Jesus comes and glory dawns, We owe it all to Thee.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}O God, how rich, how vast Thy love, Whoe’er can Thee repay? Thy love is past man’s finding out, Thy grace no man can say.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}But Lord, to me I pray Thee grant, More clearly may I see, That I may e’er more fully know How much I owe to Thee.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}But if man’s heart should e’er suppose He could repay Thy love, It only means he nothing knows Of love, all loves above.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: {lang-eng}So may we never bargains make With that dear love of Thine: The love that made Thine heart once break, Whoe’er that love could win?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v8
v9
verse.lines: {lang-eng}O Father God, we owe Thee all! All that we are and have! With grateful thanks before Thee fall, ’Tis all that we can give.{/lang-eng}
